definition:
The *order* of an elliptic function is the number of poles of the
function contained within a fundamental period parallelogram, counted
with multiplicity. Sometimes the term “degree” is also used — this usage
agrees with the theory of Riemann surfaces.

This order is always a finite number; this follows from the fact that a
meromorphic function can only have a finite number of poles in a compact
region (such as the closure of a period parallelogram). As it turns out,
the order can be any integer greater than 1.
